page.title: 08Fairford Air Tattoo 1985
page.content: The RAF had planned to hold the 1985 Internationl Air Tattoo at Greenham Common.The Air Tattoo was held on {Saturday and Sunday 13th and 14th {July 1985.}During the week before the show many aircraft arrived attracting people to take{photographs}especially the arrival of the Blackbird, which landed at Friday lunchtime. The police errected a one way system into the base. On Saturday the{weather}was sunny with blue skies but on Sunday there were low grey clouds, which forced the air display to a lower altitude. The crowd numbered about 250,000. Dakotas were there to celebrate their{50 anniversary.}Other notable aircraft were WWII aircraft, Concorde,Red Arrows,Biplanes, Helicopters,and many Jet Fighters.
